title: AB 1943
content:
The people of California enact the following. The Riverside County Transportation Commission may contract private vendors for parking enforcement and vehicle removal services as per specified Vehicle Code sections. Additionally, Section 21113 of the Vehicle Code is amended. Section 21113 of the Vehicle Code is amended to prohibit driving, parking, or leaving a vehicle on the grounds of various institutions, including schools, parks, airports, public transportation agencies, and government buildings. The Vehicle Code prohibits driving, parking, or leaving a vehicle on the grounds of various institutions, including state, county, or hospital buildings, harbor districts, highway districts, state grounds served by the California Highway Patrol, and properties controlled by housing authorities. The activities described in paragraph (1) may be performed with permission and subject to conditions imposed by various governing bodies such as municipalities, public schools, state institutions, transportation agencies, and other relevant authorities. The governing board, legislative body, or officer must post signs and provide a written statement of special conditions and regulations. When allowing public traffic on their property, all traffic laws apply unless specific conditions or regulations are in place. A public transportation agency can enforce parking conditions and regulations by either following Article 3 of Chapter 1 of Division 17 or designating employees to remove vehicles as per Chapter 10 of Division 11. (e) Changes in the use of vehicles or animals on municipal property must be approved by the legislative body at a public meeting. 
(f) A transit development board has the authority to regulate the use of bicycles, motorized bicycles, electric bicycles, skateboards, electrically motorized boards, and roller skates on its property. (g) Public agencies, like the University of California Regents and California State University Trustees, can set rules for the use of bicycles, motorized bicycles, electric bicycles, skateboards, electrically motorized boards, and roller skates on their property. 
(h) "Housing authority" refers to specific housing authorities in counties with over 6,000,000 people that comply with the section's requirements. 
(i) "Public transportation agency" means an agency providing public transportation as defined in the California Constitution or a county transportation commission.
